result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristine M. Yudis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kristine M. Yudis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kristine M. Yudis was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Minutes:  15CF141/15CF622.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Lara Parker.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.

15CF141 - deft pleads no contest to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Count 1 is dismissed on State's motion.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 2 days KCJ.  Credit for 2 days served.  Costs ordered.  30 DTP.  In default, 4 days work crew or 4 days KCJ consec.  Appeal rights.  

15CF622 - case dismissed on State's motion per plea agreement with 15CF141.
